channel.title: Mountain Drawn : Personal site and photo blog of Patrick Lewis - Blog

item.title: Employee travel guides on HomeAway
item.description:
Original photo of Diving in Jacob’s Well on Flicker

I recently contributed a couple of employee travel guides / trips reports to HomeAway.com. The travel guides were lacking in outdoor adventures. One is titled Austin, TX Outdoor Adventures and covers all of the rock climbing walls on the Greenbelt, kayaking & tubing Barton Creek, and a few more activities and places. A second article titled Climbing Mountains Around Seattle, WA covers Mount Rainier, Mount Adams, Mount Baker, Mount Shuksan, and Glacier Peak.
item.dc:creator: Patrick

item.title: Texas River Flow, my 10k contest entry
item.description:
Texas River Flow App

Part of the app is currently broken due to a change in the USGS api.

My entry in the aneventapart10k contest is a little application that lets you check the river flow (cfs) of Texas rivers. The application gets it’s data from the “USGS water data service“http://waterdata.usgs.gov/nwis along with related photos from flickr.
item.dc:creator: Patrick

item.title: The Devils River, Memorial Day 2010
item.description: Put in at Baker’s Crossing on Friday, May 28th and paddled to The Indian Head Ranch 40 miles down river.
item.dc:creator: Patrick

item.title: Adam's Glacier Route, Mount Adams
item.description: With seven of us on the climb this year it felt more like an expedition.
item.dc:creator: Patrick

item.title: Devils River Kayaking, July 4th 2009
item.description: We put in the kayaks at Bakers Crossing on Friday, July 3rd. The next 2 days we covered 23 miles to our take out at Gerald Baily’s place, Devils River Outfitters.
item.dc:creator: Patrick
